cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles NE of Havana, Cuba and 60 miles S of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, forecast to turn WNW Monday, NW Tuesday and then curve toward the Florida Big-Bend / northeastern Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the Florida Big Bend and subsequently the Southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (western side of storm, guidance <3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤11%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts in squalls possible late Wed-Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible if track shifts west; otherwise negligible
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 1–3 inches Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas/swells and scattered thunderstorms could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations
